April

DateQuestionAnswer
4/8What does the word 'keen' in 'keen eye' mean?Intense
4/18The places where people dumped waste in the Jomon period — what are they called?Middens
4/27Which of these is not an algebraic spiral?A

May

DateQuestionAnswer
5/6What do we call the phenomenon where the weights of rice and other crops harvested aren't exact?Moisture
5/13Which tool did the police use to direct traffic before traffic lights were invented?A hand-cranked semaphore
5/15Which of the following is the highest mountain in the solar system?Olympus Mons

June

DateQuestionAnswer
6/15Fill in the blank: The _____ of a 'keen eye' means being able to see things clearly.Keen eye
6/17What early religious practice was the origin of magic?Shamanism
6/22What kind of money was primarily used during the Edo period?Gold
6/25Which of these is the name for water without dissolved oxygen?Dead water
6/29What is the term for the phenomenon when a second hand on a clock appears to stop?Chronostasis

July

DateQuestionAnswer
7/3Which of these phrases is the saying about how 'ichirin' is read?A single flower
7/8What is the collective term for the natural phenomena of lightning, thunder, and thunderbolts?Thunderstorm
7/9Between which two months do we have the longest number of days without a national holiday?June and July
7/10Which form of Japanese poetry is the shortest?Haiku
7/11What mythological figure sacrificed an eye to gain knowledge?Odin

September

DateQuestionAnswer

9/26Who was the monk famous for running 1000 marathons?Saichō
